name: Malian Ginger Juice
author: TFRach
summary: A popular and refreshing drink from West Africa. If it's too spicy, dilute with water. All ingredients can be adjusted to taste. This drink is great for cutting the heaviness of fried foods. Enjoy!
ingredients: ⅓ pound fresh unpeeled ginger root, cut into 1/2-inch chunks
1 ½ cups water, or as needed to cover
directions: Place ginger into a blender, cover with 1 1/2 cup water, and blend until ginger is thick and pasty
Strain and squeeze juice from ginger pulp into a 2-quart pitcher, squeezing ginger mixture as dry as possible
Stir lemon juice and sugar into ginger juice until sugar has dissolved
Pour 7 cups water into mixture, stir to combine, and serve garnished with crushed mint leaves
